POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_PATENT_USE_DES: This licence provides an express grant of patent rights from contributors.
This licence explicitly states that it does NOT grant any rights in the patents of contributors.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_INCLUDE_COPYRI: A copy of the licence and copyright notice must be included with the software.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_SAME_LICENSE_D: Modifications must be released under the same licence when distributing the software. In some cases a similar or related licence may be used.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_LIABILITY_DESC: This licence includes a limitation of liability.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_TRADEMARK_USE_: This licence explicitly states that it does NOT grant trademark rights, even though licences without such a statement probably do not grant any implicit trademark rights.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_WARRANTY_DESC: The licence explicitly states that it does NOT provide any warranty.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_0BSD: The BSD Zero Clause licence goes further than the BSD 2-Clause license to allow you unlimited freedom with the software without requirements to include the copyright notice, licence text, or disclaimer in either source or binary forms.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_AFL-3.0: The Academic Free Licence is a variant of the Open Software Licence that does not require that the source code of derivative works be disclosed. It contains explicit copyright and patent grants and reserves trademark rights in the author.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_AGPL-3.0: Permissions of this strongest copyleft licence are conditioned on making available complete source code of licenced works and modifications, which include larger works using a licenced work, under the same licence. Copyright and licence notices must be preserved. Contributors provide an express grant of patent rights. When a modified version is used to provide a service over a network, the complete source code of the modified version must be made available.
A permissive licence whose main conditions require preservation of copyright and licence notices. Contributors provide an express grant of patent rights. Licenced works, modifications, and larger works may be distributed under different terms and without source code.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_Artistic-: Heavily favoured by the Perl community, the Artistic licence requires that modified versions of the software do not prevent users from running the standard version.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_BSD-2-Cla: A permissive licence that comes in two variants, the BSD 2-Clause and BSD 3-Clause. Both have very minute differences to the MIT licence.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_BSD-3-Cla: A variant of the BSD 3-Clause Licence that explicitly does not grant any patent rights.

A permissive licence similar to the BSD 2-Clause Licence, but with a 3rd clause that prohibits others from using the name of the project or its contributors to promote derived products without written consent.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_BSL-1.0: A simple permissive licence only requiring preservation of copyright and licence notices for source (and not binary) distribution. Licenced works, modifications, and larger works may be distributed under different terms and without source code.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_CC-BY-4.0: Permits almost any use subject to providing credit and licence notice. Frequently used for media assets and educational materials. The most common licence for Open Access scientific publications. Not recommended for software.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_CC-BY-SA-: Similar to CC-BY-4.0 but requires derivatives be distributed under the same or a similar, compatible licence. Frequently used for media assets and educational materials. A previous version is the default licence for Wikipedia and other Wikimedia projects. Not recommended for software.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_CC0-1.0: The Creative Commons CC0 Public Domain Dedication waives copyright interest in a work you've created and dedicates it to the world-wide public domain. Use CC0 to opt out of copyright entirely and ensure your work has the widest reach. As with the Unlicence and typical software licences, CC0 disclaims warranties. CC0 is very similar to the Unlicence.
Strong copyleft licence made by three French public research organisations, CEA, CNRS, and Inria, compatible with AGPL-3.0, EUPL-1.1, and GPL-2.0, or later versions of those licences.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_ECL-2.0: The Educational Community Licence version 2.0 ("ECL") consists of the Apache 2.0 licence, modified to change the scope of the patent grant in section 3 to be specific to the needs of the education communities using this licence.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_EPL-1.0: This commercially-friendly copyleft licence provides the ability to commercially licence binaries; a modern royalty-free patent licence grant; and the ability for linked works to use other licences, including commercial ones.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_EPL-2.0: This commercially-friendly copyleft licence provides the ability to commercially licence binaries; a modern royalty-free patent licence grant; and the ability for linked works to use other licences, including commercial ones.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_EUPL-1.1: The “European Union Public Licence” (EUPL) is a copyleft free/open source software licence created on the initiative of and approved by the European Commission in 22 official languages of the European Union.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_EUPL-1.2: The European Union Public Licence (EUPL) is a copyleft free/open source software licence created on the initiative of and approved by the European Commission in 22 official languages of the European Union.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_GPL-2.0: The GNU GPL is the most widely used free software licence and has a strong copyleft requirement. When distributing derived works, the source code of the work must be made available under the same licence. There are multiple variants of the GNU GPL, each with different requirements.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_GPL-3.0: Permissions of this strong copyleft licence are conditioned on making available complete source code of licenced works and modifications, which include larger works using a licenced work, under the same licence. Copyright and licence notices must be preserved. Contributors provide an express grant of patent rights.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_ISC: A permissive licence lets people do anything with your code with proper attribution and without warranty. The ISC licence is functionally equivalent to the BSD 2-Clause and MIT licences, removing some language that is no longer necessary.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_LGPL-2.1: Primarily used for software libraries, the GNU LGPL requires that derived works be licenced under the same licence, but works that only link to it do not fall under this restriction. There are two commonly used versions of the GNU LGPL.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_LGPL-3.0: Permissions of this copyleft licence are conditioned on making available complete source code of licenced works and modifications under the same licence or the GNU GPLv3. Copyright and licence notices must be preserved. Contributors provide an express grant of patent rights. However, a larger work using the licenced work through interfaces provided by the licenced work may be distributed under different terms and without source code for the larger work.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_LPPL-1.3c: The LaTeX Project Public Licence (LPPL) is the primary licence under which the LaTeX kernel and the base LaTeX packages are distributed.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_MIT: A short and simple permissive licence with conditions only requiring preservation of copyright and licence notices. Licenced works, modifications, and larger works may be distributed under different terms and without source code.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_MPL-2.0: Permissions of this weak copyleft licence are conditioned on making available source code of licenced files and modifications of those files under the same licence (or in certain cases, one of the GNU licences). Copyright and licence notices must be preserved. Contributors provide an express grant of patent rights. However, a larger work using the licenced work may be distributed under different terms and without source code for files added in the larger work.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_MS-PL: An open source licence with a patent grant.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_MS-RL: An open source licence with a patent grant similar to the Microsoft Public License, with the additional condition that any source code for any derived file be provided under this licence.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_NCSA: The University of Illinois/NCSA Open Source Licence, or UIUC licence, is a permissive free software licence, based on the MIT/X11 licence and the BSD 3-clause Licence. Its conditions include requiring the preservation of copyright and licence notices both in source and in binary distributions and the prohibition of using the names of the authors or the project organisation to promote or endorse derived products.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_ODbL-1.0: The Open Database Licence (ODbL) is a licence agreement intended to allow users to freely share, modify, and use a database while maintaining this same freedom for others.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_OFL-1.1: The Open Font Licence (OFL) is maintained by SIL International. It attempts to be a compromise between the values of the free software and typeface design communities. It is used for almost all open source font projects, including those by Adobe, Google and Mozilla.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_OSL-3.0: OSL 3.0 is a copyleft licence that does not require reciprocal licensing on linked works. It also provides an express grant of patent rights from contributors to users, with a termination clause triggered if a user files a patent infringement lawsuit.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_PostgreSQ: A very short, BSD-style licence, used specifically for PostgreSQL.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_Unlicense: A licence with no conditions whatsoever which dedicates works to the public domain. Unlicenced works, modifications, and larger works may be distributed under different terms and without source code.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_UPL-1.0: A permissive, OSI and FSF approved, GPL compatible licence, expressly allowing attribution with just a copyright notice and a short form link rather than the full text of the licence. Includes an express grant of patent rights. Licenced works and modifications may be distributed under different terms and without source code, and the patent grant may also optionally be expanded to larger works to permit use as a contributor licence agreement.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_WTFPL: The easiest licence out there. It gives the user permissions to do whatever they want with your code.
POWERCORD_PLUGINS_LICENSE_DESC_Zlib: A short permissive licence, compatible with GPL. Requires altered source versions to be documented as such.
